title: Instant Pot Southern Cabbage Recipe
description: This Instant Pot cabbage recipe features chopped cabbage and bacon quickly and easily made in a pressure cooker for a tasty, sweet, savory side dish.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Vegetables Instant Pot Southern Cabbage 4.7 (79) 63 Reviews 14 Photos This Instant Pot cabbage recipe can be served with cornbread or as a side dish to your favorite meal. Preparing cabbage in a pressure cooker preserves most nutrients and produces a sweet yet savory dish. This recipe is quick, flavorful, and easy! Submitted by EyeSpy Updated on November 16, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 14 14 14 14 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 35 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 3 slices bacon, cut into 1/2 inch pieces ¼ cup butter 1 head cabbage, cored and chopped into 1 1/2-inch pieces 2 cups chicken broth salt and ground black pepper to taste Directions Cook and stir bacon in an open 8-quart pressure cooker over medium heat until tender, 4 to 5 minutes. Do not crisp bacon unless you prefer it that way. Add butter and stir until melted. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add cabbage to bacon-butter mixture and pour in broth. Season with salt and pepper; toss cabbage until coated. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Secure the lid, place the regulator on top (depending on the type of pressure cooker you have), and turn heat to high. When the regulator begins to rock or the cooker reaches full pressure, lower temperature until the regulator is gently rocking (15 pounds per square inch). Cook for 3 minutes. Immediately remove the cooker from heat. Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions. Unlock and remove the lid. Transfer cabbage to a serving plate; serve hot. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook’s Note You can add some diced cooked ham to the pot before cooking for a complete meal. I Made It Print 192 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Instant Pot Southern Cabbage 01 of 14 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 14 Photo by  A Bell 08/01/2020 I made it exactly to recipe. Absolutely love the flavor! I think I will back off the broth a little next time and I need to cut the time back just a tad, I over cooked trying to convert the instruction to work on my instant pot. Nice part, my hubby said it’s the best I’ve ever made and both kids ate it and liked it!! That’s a major win! 03 of 14 Photo by  A Bell 08/01/2020 I made it exactly to recipe. Absolutely love the flavor! I think I will back off the broth a little next time and I need to cut the time back just a tad, I over cooked trying to convert the instruction to work on my instant pot. Nice part, my hubby said it’s the best I’ve ever made and both kids ate it and liked it!! That’s a major win! 04 of 14 Photo by  Sylvia Chandler 05/19/2020 05 of 14 Photo by  James Stringfellow 01/05/2020 06 of 14 Photo by  Bianca 01/01/2020 07 of 14 Photo by  Heather Schenck-Mason 03/23/2019 08 of 14 Photo by  Tina S 12/15/2018 09 of 14 Photo by  Nicole Scott Johnson Flores 11/25/2018 10 of 14 Photo by  paige nicole 05/01/2018 i love this recipe! i used an xL cabbage head so I added more bacon and more broth. will definitely make it again. 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Smothered Collard Greens and Cabbage 52 Ratings Fried Cabbage Texas Style 32 Ratings Southern Fried Cabbage with Bacon, Mushrooms, and Onions 288 Ratings Southern Fried Cabbage 756 Ratings Creamy Cabbage with Apples and Bacon 27 Ratings Vegetables and Cabbage Stir-Fry with Oyster Sauce 4 Ratings Smothered Cabbage 53 Ratings Fried Cabbage and Bacon 914 Ratings Creamed Cabbage 240 Ratings Grandma Jeanette's Amazing German Red Cabbage 582 Ratings Foil-Wrapped Cabbage 11 Ratings Grilled Cabbage 6 Ratings Cabbage Pancakes 13 Ratings Fried Cabbage with Bacon, Onion, and Garlic 1,320 Ratings Spicy Cajun Cabbage 32 Ratings Barbequed Cabbage 93 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
